page.title: 02A Social Survey in Kirkby
page.content: Most of the people we interviewed had been born in Kirkby or had lived here most of their lives. Twenty one people had been born in Kirkby and nineteen had lived here for over twenty years. Fourteen had lived here between ten and twenty years and seventeen had lived here less than ten years. Most of the people we spoke to were unemployed or retired. Forty-six were unemployed. Seven people lived in Kirkby but worked elsewhere but twenty-two lived and worked in our town. Most of the people who were in work were miners or worked in shops or offices. It was mostly ladies who were unemployed. Four people had their own businesses. One person owned a garage. Most unemployed people didn't know what they would have liked to do.
